Name: Mora Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: This has beautiful aromas of sweet, black cherries, with raspberry notes and a hint of olive  savourieness. The palate is ripe but balanced with beautifully layered fruit and good sturcture.

Name: Vernaccia Valle del Tirso Igt Sa Crannatza de Silviu Cata
Tasting Notes: Golden hue, bone dry fortified wine with saline minerality and a nutty iodine character on the complex palate. tangy food wine.

Name: Gladysdale Chardonnay
Tasting Notes: Flinty notes on the nose with lots of fruit - yellow peach, melon, nashi pear. Concentrated with lovely nutty complexity and lemony acid persistence

Name: Trama Pinot Noir
Tasting Notes: Intense red berry attack, a bright and lively glassful with cranberry appeal. Juicy forward style with pleasant grip from balanced tannins.

Name: Altazor
Trophies: ['Maipo Valley Cabernet blend Trophy,  Chilean Red Trophy']
Tasting Notes: A classic Maipo Valley expression showing strength and high-altitude freshness. Dried herbs, plum and damson lead to a long finish with sinewy tannins and gripping acidity for structure and lift.

Name: Granito Semillón
Tasting Notes: Lovely, complex nose with bright lemon, nutty aromas, clove, mince and some wild flower notes. Palate has ripe fruit and a rich style.

Name: Gevrey Chambertin
Tasting Notes: Charming wild strawberries, velvety, with hints of chocolate and leather, textured soft tanninsbalanced by elegant fruit.

Name: D Block Shingleback Reserve McLaren Vale Shiraz
Tasting Notes: Creamy blueberry aromas, minty eucalyptus and dark berries with harmonious silky, integrated tannins. Wonderful example of how McLaren Vale can give you all the nice ripe blackberry and blueberry, firm and great.

Name: McGuigan Genus 4 Riesling
Tasting Notes: expressive preserved lemon, apple blossom honey, toast, extraordinarily complex, balance, length, freshness and harmony, just stunning!

Name: McGuigan Bin 9000 Semillon
Trophies: ['Hunter Valley Semillon Trophy,  Australian Semillon Trophy']
Tasting Notes: This mature Hunter Semillon has amazing aromatics of toast, spice, lovely mandarin and lime. The palate is bright and linear with amazing focus and a hint of creaminess, along with citrus pith and mandarin. Lovely weight and texture.

Name: McGuigan Bin 9000 Semillon
Tasting Notes: A fleshy style with lemon curd, thyme and herbs on the nose. Great balance and energy.  Greengage with a buzzy mineral tone that lingers on the finish.

Name: Chapel Hill Road Block McLaren Vale Shiraz
Tasting Notes: Sultry, deep voluptuous ripe fruits- blueberries, blackberries and sloes-livened up with cracked black pepper and mouth-wateringly chewy tannins.

Name: Cat Amongst the Pigeons  Fat Cat Barossa Shiraz
Tasting Notes: Very pretty blueberry fruit. Crunchy mid-palate vibrancy. Minty finish.

Name: Waitrose No.1 Côtes Du Rhône Villages
Tasting Notes: Sweet, juicy core of ripe black fruit, hints of cedar and truffle. Ripe generous finish.

Name: Brancott Estate Letter Series B Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc
Tasting Notes: Wow! Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc is often a classic dry white, but this example layers lemon zest, kiwi and greengage with a lush, long finish of tinned peaches and richness.

Name: Church Road 1 Merlot
Trophies: ['Hawkes Bay Merlot Trophy,  New Zealand Merlot Trophy,  International Merlot Trophy']
Tasting Notes: Youthful, deep dark red colour with dark fruit aromas of plums, damsons, and berries. Dark chocolate and leafy layers follow, with herb-laced black fruit and an impressive, spicy, fine tannin finish.

Name: Church Road Grand Reserve Chardonnay
Trophies: ['Hawkes Bay Chardonnay Trophy,  New Zealand Chardonnay Trophy,  New Zealand White Trophy']
Tasting Notes: Best vintage of Hawke's Bay Chardonnay, brimming examples of world class wine, full of sun baked ripeness, lime and golden peach fruit. Lime upping its tanginess, hazel and toasted cashew nut savouriness fine splashed with salt. Uplifting finish and beautifully complex.

Name: Church Road Grand Reserve Syrah
Tasting Notes: Upllifting coffee and mocha notes - supple cherry fruit with notes of black pepper on the finish.

Name: Stoneleigh Riesling
Tasting Notes: A perfectly judged sweetness and balanced acidity. Lovely clean aromas and pure, elegant and focused flavours with layers of honeysuckle, wet stones and lime on a lingering finish.

Name: Keyneton Euphonium
Tasting Notes: Ripe black cherries, blackberries, dark chocolate, licorice and eucalyptus. Well integrated oak with velvety tannins, rounded and harmonious. Long lasting finish with good intensity.
